subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Oujia Board Testing
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_0057_01C9BADC.4A863290
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

It would have to present consistent results first. Then I would trust it...=
to a point. I could never be 100% sure and that is fine by me.

So in the e=
nd, it really doesn't matter. I would be happy just knowing that I have pro=
ven to myself that I am conversing with a sentient being.

  ----- Original=
 Message ----- 
  From: lori bogren 
  To: evp-itc@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent:=
 Saturday, April 11, 2009 6:03 PM
  Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Oujia Board Test=
ing





  April~
   
  So my next question would be, how do you know it wo=
uldn't be "prankster".  Providing accurate information until a personal que=
stion about itself was asked and then mislead?
   
  ~Lori
  PS:  Did I tel=
l you there's a running joke amongst my friends about my paranoia?  :)




=
  "My life is boring, my fantasies are a theme park." 
  --Anne Rice  Respo=
nding to an interviewer who just did not get it. 



    




-------------=
-----------------------------------------------------------------
  To: EVP=
-ITC@yahoogroups.com
  From: april@...
  Date: Sat=
, 11 Apr 2009 16:55:22 -0600
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Oujia Board Testing

=




  I would try it both ways -solo and with another person. However I wou=
ld limit it to just me and one other trustworthy person.


  "How would you=
 go about determining/verified whether it's a ghost (someone stuck in betwe=
en life and the other side), a spirit (someone that's crossed over and came=
 back to say high) and some other type of entity?"

  Only after establishi=
ng that I am indeed communicating with a spirit, and that spirit has given =
me trustworthy info consistently, at that point I would simply ask what it'=
s nature is.

  April

    ----- Original Message ----- 
    From: lori bog=
ren 
    To: evp-itc@yahoogroups.com 
    Sent: Saturday, April 11, 2009 2:=
48 PM
    Subject: [EVP-ITC] Oujia Board Testing


    April~
     
    Are=
 you planning on doing this solo or working with a team?
     
    How woul=
d you go about determining/verified whether it's a ghost (someone stuck in =
between life and the other side), a spirit (someone that's crossed over and=
 came back to say high) and some other type of entity?
     
    ~Lori




=
    "My life is boring, my fantasies are a theme park." 
    --Anne Rice  R=
esponding to an interviewer who just did not get it. 



      




-------=
---------------------------------------------------------------------
    T=
o: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
    From: april@...
   =
 Date: Fri, 10 Apr 2009 22:37:13 -0600
    Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] An altern=
ative to the usual ghost hunter stuff.





    Well, if my husband would l=
et me actually experiment with one, that would be the first step LOL!

    =
But what I would try and do is get some kind of verifiable information from=
 the "entity" that I contact with the board to prove that it is communicati=
on from an actual, intelligent being and not just my own motor responses ma=
king he planchette move. It would have to be information that I have no kno=
wledge of.

    If I could do that, and consistently, then I would be comfo=
rtable saying that I am actually talking to a spirit.

    The reason I hav=
e my doubts is that you have to be touching the planchette to get it to mov=
e. If it were an actual spirit, I would think that shouldn't be necessary. =
We all know ghosts can a do move objects.

    But this brings up another m=
ystery - if the Ouija board is actual spirit communication, maybe there is =
a difference between the entities you can contact with it and your common g=
host.

    April

      ----- Original Message ----- 
      From: lori bogr=
en 
      To: evp-itc@yahoogroups.com 
      Sent: Friday, April 10, 2009 9=
:50 PM
      Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] An alternative to the usual ghost hunte=
r stuff.


      April~
       
      Hm, finally I'm intrigued again.
    =
   
      How do you about the process?
       
      ~Lori




      "My l=
ife is boring, my fantasies are a theme park." 
      --Anne Rice  Respondi=
ng to an interviewer who just did not get it. 



        




------------=
--------------------------------------------------------------
      To: EV=
P-ITC@yahoogroups.com
      From: april@...
      =
Date: Fri, 10 Apr 2009 18:36:30 -0600
      Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] An alter=
native to the usual ghost hunter stuff.


      .


      When it comes to =
the Ouija, I just want to study it to find out if it is really spirit commu=
nication, or just kinetic energy or your subconscious mind moving the planc=
hette.

      I agree that we all have the ability for extra sensory percep=
tion, just some are better at it than others. Like running, for instance. W=
e all can run, but some are naturally better at it. Still, with practice we=
 can get better.

      But that is not my aim with the Ouija.


        --=
--- Original Message ----- 
        From: lori bogren 
        To: evp-itc@=
yahoogroups.com 
        Sent: Friday, April 10, 2009 6:11 PM
        Subje=
ct: RE: [EVP-ITC] An alternative to the usual ghost hunter stuff.


       =
 April~
         
        You forgot yawn from boredom, that's what I do.
 =
        
        Use it, don't use it.  I don't care.  But why bother.  Whe=
n people ask me I usually suggest that if they want to communicate with ...=
 whatever why not develop the ability yourself.  - ya, I'm one of those who=
 believe anyone can.
         
        There's always the question in the b=
ack of your mind whether your partner's moving it.  The intentions of "what=
" you are talking to.  Not to mention it's too slow and limited.
         
=
        Besides if you take the time to develop the ability you can get mor=
e texture in the information.  Asking the board "where you married?" may ge=
t you a "yes" but a psychic might get the sense of a religious or civil cer=
emonhy, the garment(s) worn, other's in the party, or whether that Being ap=
proved/disapproved of their spouse (ie was it a reluctant union).
         =

        ~Lori
